intro: Hahnia aria glabrata, commonly known as the smooth hahnia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
